ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Jeff Stoike
Jeff Stoike
Jeff Stoike
Jeff Stoike

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This class was all about the readings and discussions. I rally liked this class. The students taking it this semester were all very involved and insightful.
The readings and class discussions.
The reading materials and the subsequent class lectures and discussions. Additionally, the ability to work towards my final thesis work.
The other students

Professor Dove approaches environmental issues from a different perspective than many of the professors, and courses offered, at F&ES. The assigned readings tie in well with the short lectures and group discussions. I especially enjoyed the discussions and guest speakers, which were provocative throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Nothing really.
While the discussions were a definite strength of the course, they sometimes seemed to wander a bit, which i enjoy, but might not suit all of the students in the course.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Above and beyond, both were great.
Excellent
The instructor is a busy man, the TA was available more of the time. Either were available through email.

The availability and quality of the help I received from Professor Dove and Jeff Stoike was excellent. Both were available to meet with me regularly and contributed significantly to my understanding of the readings and discussions.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It provides a great opportunity to go deeper into social science, particularly in the context of disasters and perturbation- and how societies confront them. I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in climate change, disasters, ecological perturbations, international policy-making and community-based conservation initiatives.

Technically it doesn't. However I used this class and its precursor to work on questions I had from my internship this past summer. I learned an incredible amount in this class and it was very helpful in rounding out my education here.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It's the course that I've been most interested in taking since coming to FES.
Integral part of my master's thesis.
To answer questions I had from my internship this summer.

I took this course because of the quality of the course material, the design of the course, and the professor. This is a unique course at F&ES, and it is important to any student interested in climate change, conservation, and/or development.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Yes
The course absolutely lived up to my expectations.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: And more.
Yes
Yes
I got exactly what I expected from the course.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Partcipated in class discussions as a group. Experience was great because it brought a number of different points of view together and produced a number of ideas and themes that would have not surfaced were it not for these collaborations.
The group work in this class is minimal. but it is nice to sit an talk about a weeks readings with a subset of the class.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: The course is what you make of it. Do the readings and engage in class discussion, that's where you will truly reap the benefits of this course- particularly as a warm-up to writing your final paper.
Start your final paper early. Get a move on the class reading early on in the week to budget your time as they are quite extensive.

This is a lot of reading, and the readings are the whole class so if you want to have anything to say in class you have to do all the readings. I was dedicating 10+ hours a week to the readings and weekly responses.
